item.description:

item.title: Abandoned vehicle, 5th July
item.description:
This vehicle has been there for several months now. The bumper was damaged but hanging down, now it’s completely detached and became a driving hazard for other cars driving on the street. Please review the case as a matter of urgency as it has been already raised for investigation over a month ago.

item.title: Continuous Leak from under a wall, 5th July
item.description:
There is water leak coming from under a wall. It is continuous. It has been here for over a year. In winter the water freezes a the pavement becomes unsafe for people to walk ok. In summer the water pos around the pavement and road a it smells badly. It is a hazard.

item.title: Humans noise, crowds and amplified music, bass Hyde Park throughout area, 5th July
item.description:
Hyde Park concert noise broadcast throughout residential area east of the Park. Horrendous deep growling booming noise and roaring. Way too loud. Where is the direct line to the on site noise team for residents to use?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grosvenor Place, Belgravia, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog foul around the park entrance, 5th July
item.description:
There is a lack of bins at Hawkwood park, and since then the park has been full of dog poo, and poo bags have been left by the entrance. Today when we went there was dog poo everywhere and loads of poo bags littered across the park.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Chislehurst, London

item.title: Vehucle continuing to park across the pavement, 5th July
item.description:
32 Freelands Road continually park across the pavement making it impassable for anyone with a pram or wheelchair or even with shopping. I have already complained in the past and they did stop but it seems they’ve slipped back into doing it again. Number plate is LJ74 CLM.

item.title: Loud music/bass causing building to rock, 5th July
item.description:
Music is ok, but above a certain decibel it causes the building to rock, is it possible to work with the organisers to ensure it isn't above the amount the will rock the building? Esp after the burst pipe lasting majority of today - potential subsidence?
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Portland Rise, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage caused by lorries mounting pavement when entering adjacent building., 5th July
item.description:
Severe damage caused by lorries mounting pavement to make turn in on multiple occasions. As a result, apart from damage to the kerbstone, two manholes have been displaced and some of the water meters within are now exposed. The pavement is impassable. This issue has occurred before and will again unless the council takes appropriate action. The underling problem is the result of the council failing to head warnings from residents who told them the turn-in was too tight for long vehicles. In practice long vehicles have to mount the pavement to make the turn on occasion. This practice should be stopped immediately and the property owners instructed to prevent it, but the only long term solution is to bar the use of this turn in by lorries per se. The owners of the building should reconfigure the building to make this possible. There is a huge car park that is underused at the other end of the property - that should be made the goods entrance for this building at the property owner's expense.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crabtree Manorway North, Lower Belvedere, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sunken road surface on pedestrian crossing near Greggs store dangerous for public crossing. Road requires full reconstruction not patching., 5th July
